string.value: My hunch was right about #bShammos#k. He knew a bit more and was able to give me further details, but there's something strange about what #p2022003# said. Let's ask #b#p2020010##k. Finally getting somewhere! \n\n#t4161027# #b#c4161027# / 1#k

I took the book back to #p2020010# following a lead from #bShammos#k. Rene said that #p2022003# used to be human and that I should pay close attention to what he says--both as a warning and path to discovering more.
Yes! Yes! That's right. This is that! You don't know someone who knows about this book? \n\r#L0# #bDo you know? #k
Hahahaha! How would #p2022003# know! Never! Never! Nobody knows!
No body in the world knows about the book! Never! Hahaha! I don't need that book! Take it back!
Never known nobody who knows nothing about anything! Nobody! You neither! #p2020010# doesn't know either! Hahaha!

Are you sure #p2022003# said that? That's interesting. He looks inhuman now, but #p2022003# used to be a human and intelligent. He speaks in wicked ways while he is very wise. You should take it seriously. He only appears crazy...
Let me think about #p2022003#'s story. Please come back later and I should be able to tell you some more.
Tell #p2020010# to be quiet! There's too much noise in here!
Have you seen #b#p2022003##k? And by the way, where did you leave your book?
*Giggle* Is this what you've lost? I don't feel like giving it back to you. Well, maybe for a donation...kidding!
